content: Indeed! Steep stairs and narrow doorways can be significant barriers for people with mobility impairments, especially in older subway stations. Although Seoul has made significant progress in improving accessibility in public transportation, such challenges still exist. However, Seoul and other cities are continuously working to address these issues through infrastructure modifications and raising awareness among people. It's essential for cities to prioritize accessibility and listen to the needs and feedback of their citizens, particularly those with disabilities. With the right approach, it is entirely possible to create an inclusive and accessible public transportation system that meets the needs of all people, regardless of their abilities or disabilities.
